inn1.comm: starts with a fullish ball that swings into his pads, and he tucks it away towards mid-on to get off the mark
back of a length on middle and off. Amla defends off the back foot
a touch fuller, a bit of shape away from off stump. Amla gets a half stride out to defend towards mid-off
length ball on off stump, checked drive to mid-off
bouncer, and Ronchi has to leap off the ground and go full stretch over his head to collect after Amla ducks under the ball
back of a length outside off, and Amla leaves comfortably
full, leg-stumpish, and de Kock clips it off his toes down to the deep backward square leg boundary, to the right of the man at short fine leg
another boundary, this time flicked from middle and leg in front of square, simply leaned over the ball to send it running away to the midwicket boundary
better line, straightens from a fullish length on off stump, and he comes forward and pushes it into the covers
swings into the pads once more, and he lets it come on and plays it with a straight bat, wide of the man at mid-on
Amla's off the mark now. This one didn't swing, and came in with the angle from off towards middle. Amla stayed in his crease and tucked it away to deep backward square leg
once again too straight, and that's a nice-looking clip off the pads through square leg

lovely delivery, swings away from back of a length and takes the shoulder of Amla's bat as he shuffles back and across to defend. He played close to his body and it ran away, along the ground, wide of the diving second slip fielder
this one starts wider outside off and Amla lets it go
this one comes back in sharply from that same back-of-a-length spot outside off, and Amla is forced to jump up and jam his bat down to keep that down into the leg side
back of a length in the channel outside off, and Amla lets it go. Good carry through to Ronchi

whoa. What a ball that was. It was angled in, and Amla had to play at it lest it go with the angle and crash into his off stump. It swung away late and beat his outside edge, opening him up completely
cuts back in once more and crashes into Amla's right thigh as he jumps to get on top of the bounce
slanted across de Kock, too far across, and the umpire signals wide
better line this time, moves in a touch from back of a length towards middle and off, and he defends with a straight bat down the pitch
this one's angling towards off stump, and de Kock leans forward and punches it to cover
a bit of extra bounce. Looked to flick that and got a thin inside edge that hit his pad and bounced into the off side
slanted wide of off stump. De Kock is into the drive too early and drags the ball back towards the bowler
full on off stump, driven to mid-on, the bowler dives in his follow-through and gets a fingertip on the ball
wasn't really in control of that shot, played away from his body from a half stride forward, and sliced it over point for four
comes into Amla again and he works it down to the man at deep backward square leg
back of a length, slanting away outside off, de Kock lets it go
too full, too straight, clipped off the toes to deep backward square leg
straightens late on an off-stump line. It was fairly full, but Amla stayed on the back foot and defended into the off side
that was a nasty short ball, angled in and following Amla as he swayed away hurriedly. Slightly arsh call of wide from the umpire
a touch too straight now and he flicks it over the leaping Anderson at short midwicket
outswinger wide outside off, and Amla lets it go
full on off stump, a bit of swing into de Kock, and he defends towards short midwicket
back of a length on off stump, defended towards mid-off
short ball, keeps going away from de Kock, too wide outside off for him to connect as he shapes to pull, beats the diving keeper and is given wide

close shave there. It was angled in towards leg stump and stopped on Amla a little. Amla looked to play a straight-bat punch, was through his shot too early, and the shot went uppishly and just cleared mid-on who leaped backwards to try and catch it
straightens from back of a length and beats Amla's backfoot defensive prod
comes in from back of a length, towards middle stump, and Amla defends towards short midwicket

this time he gets his man. It stopped on Amla again and bounced a little higher than he expected. He was too early into... what was that shot anyway, a flick? Ball looped straight up and down into the hands of short midwicket
back of a length, lovely line inches wide of off stump, and a good leave from de Kock
full, swings in late towards middle stump, clipped watchfully to short midwicket, with front pad scrupulously out of the way of the ball
length ball angling towards off stump, and he comes forward, lets the ball come on, and steers it away past backward point
big back-and-across movement, covers the angle across and defends towards cover
this one's a little wider outside off and Rossouw lets it go
a bit of shape in towards off stump. Riley looks to play with an angled bat into the off side, and the ball hits the inside part of the face, turns the bat, and runs away towards midwicket
full-toss wide outside off and he comes forward and puts a straight bat in the path of the ball to send it racing away past the left hand of the diving cover fielder
better length now. De Kock plays for the swing, looking towards midwicket, and the ball keeps going with the angle and takes the leading edge down to third man
back of a length, comes back into Rossouw, and he goes back and across to defend
short ball, Rossouw ducks, another wide given
full now, in the fifth-stump channel, Rossouw lets it go

there's that indifferent pace off the pitch once again. It was back of a length on leg stump, a little outside maybe, and he closed his face too early looking to play through the leg side. The ball stopped on the pitch, came off it with a bit of offcut, and the leading edge popped towards the right of Henry, who dived in his follow-through and took the catch one-handed
length ball angled across, left alone
back of a length outside off, straightens to cramp de Kock for room. Shapes to cut initially, and checks his shot to dab it towards point
back of a length on middle and leg, he let it come on and tucked it away towards square leg
length ball angling towards middle stump, and Miller defends towards midwicket, slipping and losing balance as he did so
onto the pads now and it's clipped away towards deep backward square leg
good ball, angling towards off stump. Miller got his front foot across and was looking to play for the swing, and got a thickish outside edge that dropped short of third slip
finds the edge again, as Miller pushes out uncertainly once more. This time, the ball drops short of second slip
full on middle stump, a bit of late shape away and de Kock ensured he showed the full face to defend back to the bowler
this one's a touch shorter, angled in towards middle stump, and he clips it towards short midwicket
banged in back of a length on off stump. De Kock jumps to defend towards cover point
length ball wide of off stump. De Kock goes chasing and gets a thick edge that loops over the infield and drops down in front of third man
back of a length on off stump. Miller shuffles across and tucks it away to deep backward square leg
length ball, moves in just a little bit, quite late, towards off stump, and de Kock defends off the front foot towards mid-on
too full, too straight, clipped away off the toes to the deep backward square leg boundary
back of a length, angling away outside off, left alone
a little fuller, and nice carry through to the keeper once again after Miller leaves
what a delivery that is. That's either a very good leave or a very lucky leave. It swung in late and missed the top of off stump by a mere centimeter
gets a decent stride out this time, and pushes the ball into the covers with a straight bat
full, swings in late towards off stump. De Kock keeps his front toe out of the way and clips it to mid-on
fullish ball on middle and off, driven to mid-on
shot! That was full, angling in towards off stump, and he simply showed the ball a full face and sent it hurtling past the bowler, down to the long-off boundary
back of a length on off stump, he lets it come to him and defends with a roll of his wrists to mid-on
length ball, angling in towards middle stump, targeting the lbw. He did have his front pad moving towards the ball but manages to bring his bat down in front of it to push it back to the bowler
short ball over off stump, sits up a bit and Miller pulls it punishingly down to the deep midwicket boundary
super follow-up delivery, comes back in from a fullish length outside off and beats Miller's inside edge as he prods forward to defend. Didn't miss off stump by much
looks for the full ball, slides it down the leg side
full, swings in late towards middle stump, jams his bat down to block it back to the bowler
back of a length and a bit of movement in towards middle and off and extra bounce as well. De Kock takes his bottom hand off the handle to defend
fullish ball on middle stump, driven down to mid-on
full outside off, and down comes that angled bat to dig the ball out towards deep midwicket
length ball on middle and off, tiny bit of shape into the left-hander, defended off the front foot to mid-on
a little fuller this time, and he gets his front foot out of the way and blocks it to mid-on once more
length ball outside off, and de Kock was too early into that angled-bat drive, dragged it back towards the bowler
back of a length, a bit of movement in from a middle-stump line, beats the inside edge and cannons into the top of de Kock's pad
this one's shaped away late from a nice length wide outside off. De Kock pokes away from his body and is beaten

full on off stump, and that's driven firmly back towards the bowler, who tumbles in his follow-through to try and stop the ball. Hits the bowler, ricochets towards mid-on, and they can't take a single because Miller's dived back to get in his crease in case the ball hits the stumps
length ball outside off, left alone
short ball, and de Kock can't quite middle this pull, rolls down to deep midwicket. McClenaghan brushed against the stumps as he was completing his action, and it's a no-ball
this one swings away a fair distance outside off and it's left alone. Was that so wide that the umpire had to call it wide, though?
this one's angled in towards middle stump, and he tucks it away off the pads down to deep backward square leg
back of a length, fairly close to off stump, left alone
length ball on middle and leg, angling away, and he defends this with a straight bat towards midwicket
full on middle and off, driven down to mid-off
lovely delivery. Hit the seam on a back-of-a-length spot on middle and off and left Miller and beat his outside edge as he poked away from his body
length ball on leg stump, defended towards short midwicket
back of a length on middle and off, defended towards midwicket
angled in towards middle and off, defended off the front foot
a little slower, outside off, defended towards cover
quite full again, on middle stump, clipped to short midwicket
angled in towards middle stump, not much turn, defended back to the bowler
down the pitch now, clipped down to long-on
tossed up outside off, a bit of turn, and Miller stretches out to defend into the off side
starts with a fullish, leg-stumpish ball, and he gets a little tickle on it past the diving Ronchi down to the fine leg boundary
back of a length, angling towards middle and off, and he gets on top of the bounce and defends towards midwicket
back of a length, leg-stumpish, tucked off the hips to deep backward square leg
back of a length, angling towards off stump, bit of shape in. Misses the flick and is hit on the thigh

bowled him! That was the yorker and Miller didn't offer the best response, making room and trying to lash it through the off side. Sneaked under the bat and crashed into the exposed stumps. He had come out of his crease, so you could say Miller yorked himself
shortish ball outside off, slashes at it and the edge flies over the slips for four
tossed up outside off, defended into the covers
a little bit shorter, doesn't quite come on for the cut, and he pokes it to mid-off in the end
down the track now, and the ball goes through with the arm, inside edge onto pad, runs away towards short third man
length ball on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
down the track, and defends back to the bowler
back of a length, punched down to mid-off
starts with a ball slanted down the leg side, and Ronchi takes it athletically, diving full-length to his left
back of a length outside off, left alone
a little fuller than the first wide, but it's just as wide down the leg side
oh my. now he's overcompensated, and it's way outside off stump, between the tramline and the return crease
back of a length on off stump, defended close to the body, into the off side
full and wide, slashed down to third man
back of a length outside off, poked away towards point
too full, too straight, and it's clipped nicely off the toes to the midwicket boundary
short, angling away from de Kock, and that's another wide. There's no way he was going to connect with that pull
end of a seemingly endless over, back of a length on leg stump, tucked off the hips to deep backward square leg
down the pitch to this nicely tossed-up delivery, checked drive down to long-off
now AB comes down the pitch and drives inside-out to mid-off
nice angle in towards off stump, de Kock drives to cover
shortish ball on off stump, makes some room and slaps it down to deep point
length ball on off stump, driven down to long-off
down the pitch again, stays leg-side of the ball, and punches with a straight bat to send it running away between the stumps and mid-off
length ball on off stump, punches it past the diving bowler down to mid-off, looks for the single but AB sends him back
length ball on off, defended to mid-on
not that short, but it sat up just long enough for de Kock to swivel his body through a powerful pull wide of mid-on
lovely. Swings away from back of a length and beats de Kocks' bat as it searches for the ball away from his body
and again, this time a little shorter and a little closer to off stump, beats the edge and bounces quite extravagantly too
short ball, didn't quite come on, pulled down to deep midwicket
angled in towards middle and off, driven to extra cover
a little fuller and straighter, driven past a diving short midwicket to the man at long-on
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off. That man's been sent back after AB played that shot in the previous over
a bit quicker and flatter on off stump, defended to extra cover
shortish ball on off stump, rocks back and makes room to slap that to the man at deep cover point and bring up his half-century
back of a length on middle stump, punched down to long-off
full on leg and middle, clipped down to deep backward square leg

again he's brushed the bails off as he swung his arms through his action. It was fullish on off stump, and he tumbles in his follow-through to field as the batsman punches it back down the ground. He seems to have injured his finger, jammed it between the bail and the ball
length ball on middle and off, defended towards mid-on
full on off stump, driven down to mid-off. Off the bottom of the bat, I think
length ball angling in towards off, and short cover moves in to stop the ball after de Kock punches it into the off side
short outside off, and it's dismissed to the midwicket boundary by de Kock. Crunching pull, that
full outside off, and he frees his arms and drives that between the stumps and mid-on
length ball on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on with a straight bat
tossed up full on leg stump, de Kock gets his front foot out of the way and drives to long-on
back of a length, turns in towards leg stump. AB skips away from the line and punches it to long-off
back of a length, goes with the angle towards middle stump, and he backs away to cut and gets a thickish outside edge to short third man
full on middle and leg, punched back to the bowler
so close! That stopped on the pitch again and AB oushed at it and lobbed it back towards the bowler. He dived forward but it fell just short of him
full outside off, driven past the diving short cover fielder but can't beat mid-off
shot! That was back of a length, well outside off, and he walked over to the line of the ball and pulled it away to the deep backward square leg boundary
walks across again, and Anderson bowls it full and even wider, he slashes at it and it goes uppishly but drops down short of third man
back of a length outside off and Guptill dives across to his right at backward point to cut off a well-struck square cut from AB
back of a length, straightens a bit and cramps AB as he goes back and across. He adjusts and defends to mid-off
again it comes in off the pitch from back of a length. AB is a long way across his stumps and he defends punchily to mid-off
down the track now, gets to the pitch and plays a checked drive to long-off
now AB comes down the track and drives to long-off. This is hit much firmer
again good use of the feet, gets inside the line and drives inside out to deep cover
out of his crease once more, clips it down to long-on
back of a length on off stump, he makes room and cuts hard towards deep point. Neesham slides in from deep cover to cut it off
down the track once more, converts this into a low full-toss and clips it to long-on
swings away from de Kock on a full length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, and de Kock really works his bottom wrist to jam that towards short fine leg
down the track, doesn't get to the pitch, and the ball swings in and he gets an inside edge onto his pad, bounces short of the diving wicketkeeper
shortish ball on off stump, and de Kock is in position extremely early to swat that away to the deep square leg boundary
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
comes in from back of a length and traps de Kock on the shuffle. Muted appeal, he was struck outside the line, I guess
full outside off, driven to cover
this one keeps a little low outside off. AB looks to cut and nearly chops it onto his stumps. Bounces wide of the stumps
again it doesn't come on, again AB chops a cut into the ground, this time it bounces towards backward point
full, angled in. AB misreads the line and goes for the big drtive. Ball beats his inside edge and narrowly misses off stump
back of a length on off stump, steered away towards deep point. Neesham runs from deep cover to make the stop, fumbles as he bends to pick up, allows them to run three
down the track, driven firmly towards extra cover. McCullum sprints to his right and dives full-length to save four runs
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. AB gets off his feet and bunts it away towards deep point
back of a length, angling across towards off stump, steered to third man with an open face
down the pitch. Southee surprises him with a quick bouncer and AB can't connect with a hurried-looking pull
down the pitch again, and now he bowls a back of a length ball angling in. He defends it into the covers
back of a length, stops on the pitch a bit. Worked from outside off to the right of short midwicket
back of a length on off stump. He looks to work it leg side and ends up jamming the ball into his pads
back of a length, worked away from off stump down towards deep midwicket
length ball on middle stump, clipped away to deep backward square leg
full outside off, driven to cover
shortish ball, pulled from middle stump down to deep midwicket
on the pads now, flicked away into the gap between short fine leg and deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump, punched to cover
on the pads, clipped towards deep square leg
back of a length outside off, left alone
banged in, angling into the body, and AB gets a top-edge on that pull over the keeper and one bounce over the fine leg boundary
another good short ball, and AB is a little late on his pull. Hits the side of his helmet and runs away towards the fine leg boundary
